bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to L. O. Howard, November 11, 1900

div1.p: Reed asks Howard to resolve issues around a certain species of mosquito, the C. fasciatus. Reed is apologetic for asking such an obvious question.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to L. O. Howard, November 11, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
- Copy -
Camp Columbia,
Quemados, Cuba.
Nov. 11, 1900.
Dear DMr. Howard:
div1.p:
I write to request that you will kindly tell me whether
C. fasciatus ever has the 5th joint of hind tarsi white, or is this
only peculiar to C. taeniatus? Yesterday in examining a specimen,
the scales on mesonotum had become disarranged and hence I did not
have the four stripes to depend upon, but found 5th joint, hind tarsi
white - otherwise the points entirely agreed with C. fasciatus. I
have temporarily “dubbed” the specimen C. fascistus, but don't feel
quite certain. Please pardon what must appear to you as my very great
stupidity.
div1.closer:
With best wishes,
Sincerely, yours, Walter Reed. Mr. L. O. Howard,
Entomologist,
Dept. Agriculture.
